name: Bailey Sheather ITS Portfolio
body: # Computer Programmer ### Technology Summary ####Proficient in: PHP, C#, Python, JavaScript, HTML, SQL (T & MY), CSS, jQuery, ASP.NET, Markdown ####Intermediate in: Angular.JS, SVG, MathJax ####Beginner at: Java, Swift, Objective-C, C, Factor ####Software: MS Office Suite, iLife Suite, Adobe Suite, Autodesk Suite, Visual Studio (Community / Pro & Code), Xcode, GitHub Desktop, Wireshark, MAMP, SQL Server, Unity, Active Directory, Registry Editor, Google AdWords, Google Analytics ####Operating Systems: Window (all), Macintosh OS X (all), Linux / Unix (most experience with Kali Linux) ####Languages: English (Primary), Japanese (High school level) ### Professional Experience: #### **Intern / .NET, C#, TSQL & JS programmer** Hired as a part-time programmer following commended performance in initial intern role: #####Results: - Moved existing LMS GUI onto listing, using C#. Implemented a drag and drop image uploader/re-arranger alongside existing functionality. - Built a web faced image editor to fit into LMS and CMS, using JavaScript. - Consistent refactoring of existing code, removing redundancies, etc. ###Education: - Upper Coomera State College -- Upper Coomera, QLD: **Queensland Certificate of Education** - 2015 - Upper coomera state college -- Upper Coomera, QLD **Certificate I in Business**, 2013 - Upper coomera state college -- Upper Coomera, QLD **Certificate I in Work Education**, 2013 - Griffith University -- Gold Coast, QLD **GrifBio student program**, 2014-2015 - single unit ###Community: - - 5900 Reputation on [Code Review](http://codereview.stackexchange.com/users/62429/quill) - 700 Reputation on [Stack Overflow](http://stackoverflow.com/users/3296811/quill) - 2 years volunteering at high school IT department -- gained experience with diagnosing computer fault, fixing computer issues, providing tech support to teachers and students ## Open Source By contributing in Open Source projects, Iâ€™ve gained an experience with: - Version Control - Contributing in a team environment. ###Projects contributed to: ####[`Memer`](https://github.com/ismael-miguel/memer): Jargon translator for StackExchange chatrooms, written in JavaScript. ***Skills used in creation***: - Anonymous assignment, declaration scope - Advanced use of Regular Expressions - Advanced use of HTML selectors - Maintenance of large JSON files - Maintenance of Markdown `Readme.MD` file. ####[`BigBrother`](https://github.com/The-Quill/BigBrother): A StackExchange chatroom watcher, keeps an eye on the behaviour of the inhabitants, and reports any inappropriate behaviour, written in JavaScript. Named after the antagonist of the novel 1984. ***Skills used in creation***: - Assignment of specially designed Class structure/s. - Use of WebSockets. - Use of large datasets stored within browser memory. - Managing information pools and task queuing. ####[`ReviewQueueNotifier`](https://github.com/malachi26/ReviewQueueNotifier): A JavaScript UserScript alerting a user when they have new items enter the review queue on Stack Exchange. ***Skills used in creation***: - Use of advanced `window` related functionality in JavaScript's DOM manipulator. - Use of the trees feature on repositories. ####[`GeneticDriftSimulator`](https://github.com/The-Quill/GeneticDriftSimulator): A JavaScript program simulating the Genetic Drift effect in a population. ***Skills used in creation***: - Use of Underscore.JS' simplification functions, such as `sample` and `defaults`. - Use of a constructor / class like structure to avoid unnecessary parameters.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
